Job description

FedUni TAFE – Chadstone

 Full-time, fixed-term appointment for 12 months.

An exciting opportunity has become available to become a part of a community of committed and passionate staff.

You will be responsible for the delivery of quality Vocational Education and Training including conducting assessments in the Licensed Vehicle Tester programs and the development of innovative learning activities and assessment strategies enhancing quality teaching. You will also contribute to business processes, leadership, management and mentoring.

You will possess a demonstrated ability to research, select and use a wide range of teaching and assessment strategies to suit a diverse range of students. Current automotive and vocational skills enabling you to prepare, deliver and administer vocational training and education programs in a variety of contexts are key requirements of this position.

A valid Working with Children Check (WWCC) will be required as well as a relevant automotive qualification and a minimum Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40116) (If you currently hold a TAE40110 your qualification will need to be updated by December 2018).

The salary is within the TAFE Teacher T1.1 to T5 range $53,431 to $85,613 p.a. depending on qualifications and experience (pro-rata) plus 9.5% superannuation.

APPLICATIONS CLOSE: Sunday, 16 September 2018.

Applicants are required to address the Key Selection Criteria, for further information on preparing a job application, please click here: Preparing-a-Job-Application.pdf

To view the Position Description, please click here: 848379.pdf

If you require these documents, or any other documents on this website in an alternative format please contact hr@federation.edu.au or phone (03) 5327 9756.

All University positions delivering education and/or services to children must hold a valid Working With Children Check (WWCC). Please refer to the position description for WWCC requirements.

[

Client Services Coordinator - headspace Bairnsdale - Camberwell

Company Name Relationships Australia Victoria Company Location Camberwell, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Headspace

 headspace is the National Youth Mental Health Foundation providing early intervention mental health services to 12 -25 year olds, along with assistance in promoting young peoples’ wellbeing. This covers four core areas: mental health, physical health, work and study support and alcohol and other drug services.

About RAV

Relationships Australia Victoria (RAV) is a valued provider of specialist family and relationship services. Our vision is for positive, safe and respectful relationships for couples, families, schools, workplaces and communities. Our objective is to relieve suffering, distress and helplessness and to enhance physical, social and emotional wellbeing. As a community-based, not-for-profit organisation with no religious affiliations, our services are for all members of the community, regardless of religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, lifestyle choice, cultural background or economic circumstances.

About The Role

Reporting to the Centre Manager headspace Bairnsdale, you will work in a fast-paced environment and be an experienced professional with considerable knowledge in health service operations and delivery. The Client Services Coordinator (CSC) will work collaboratively with all headspace staff, including an intake team, medical and allied health private practitioners, and administrative and support staff. The CSC provides high level practice management and administrative support to facilitate the delivery of care to young people who access the headspace centre. The CSC will play a leading role in the administrative coordination and functions of the headspace centre, using their organisation skills and knowledge of practice management systems and requirements.

Qualifications And Registrations
  • Formal qualifications (certificate or diploma level) in a relevant discipline. Or substantial experience in a similar practice management role within the health sector.
Experience
  • Demonstrated experience in a practice management/client services role within a health setting that includes general practice, private allied health practice or community services (direct service) setting.
  • Demonstrated experience developing and maintaining practice procedures for a general practice, private allied health practice setting or community services (direct service) setting.
  • Demonstrated experience supervising trainee staff.
Knowledge And Skills
  • Specialist knowledge of the processes to efficiently and effectively manage a busy multidisciplinary health service.
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with the ability to work with a diverse range of people, in particular to respond to young people with respect and sensitivity.
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills, with the ability to priories and manage multiple and competing work tasks and deliver to agreed deadlines.
  • Advanced computer skills including work processing, spreadsheets and database applications, including the capacity to learn new software packages.
This role is based in our office in headspace Bairnsdale and is for a fixed-term contract until September 2019. Our RAV and headspace centres are open, depending on client demand and operational requirements and may be open one to two evenings per week or a Saturday morning on a regular basis. For this role, you can expect to work on a Tuesday evening each week.

What we offer: You will receive a competitive remuneration package based on relevant qualifications and experience. RAV is an Employer of Choice in the community sector. RAV is a recognised public benevolent institution (PBI) and as such can offer to employees additional salary packaging and tax benefits.

If you have a specific query about this position, please contact Cate Newcomen, Centre Manager headspace Bairnsdale, phone 03 5141 6200.

Applications close 5pm, Wednesday, September 5th, 2018.

RAV is a Public Benevolent Institution and Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

Data Quality Analyst

Company Name Department of Education & Training, Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 36 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Working in a high performing, friendly team, the Data Quality Analyst will work with the Principal Data Analyst to lead the development of bespoke projects and solutions to improve vocational training activity data quality and integrity from an end-user perspective. The successful candidate will be involved in developing bespoke research and data analysis projects to directly inform the ongoing implementation of the Skills First agenda in Victoria.

The Higher Education and Skills Group (HESG) of the Department of Education and Training is seeking to appoint a Data Quality Analyst for a one-year fixed-term role.

HESG manages Skills First, the government-funded vocational education and training (VET) market in Victoria. It is responsible for driving outcomes in the VET sector, facilitating participation and achievement by supporting partnerships between learners, TAFEs and other training providers, employers and advising on public funding and regulation.

This role would suit candidates with good Excel and other data analysis tool skills, and an ability to interpret and present key messages arising from data analysis to non-technical end-users such as policy officers.

We are specifically looking for someone with the ability to understand and present data to end-users, identify data quality issues, propose solutions, and work with both internal and external stakeholders to maximise understanding, use and relevance of the data in a training and labour market policy context, through the provision of user-friendly data access tools, reports and analysis.

The position does not include responsibility for system design and architecture or the building of system-wide IT platforms.

To be considered for this position, interested candidates are requested to provide a short cover letter, up-to-date resume, and a separate written response to the key selection criteria outlined in the position description.

For more details regarding this position please see attached position description.

Department of Education and Training is committed to diversity. The Department places considerable effort and resources into responding to the needs of staff with a disability. People from disadvantaged groups are encouraged to apply for this position. Information about the Department of Education and Training's operations and employment conditions can be obtained from the following websites:www.education.vic.gov.au and http://www.education.vic.gov.au/hrweb/Pages/default.aspx.

Applications close 13/09/2018

2019 Paediatric GP Trainee

Company Name Ballarat Health Services Company Location Trawool, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

2019 Paediatric GP Trainee
Fixed Term - Full Time
(86 hrs per fortnight)
Commencing February 2019

If you currently provide, or are intending to provide paediatric medicine services to rural communities, this Rural Generalist Paediatric Training Program could be for you.

Eligibility for this position will be determined through MCCC at time of short listing. Please see position description for more information

Ballarat Base Hospital has a 16-bed Paediatric Ward and a 12-bed level 2A Special Care Nursery (CPAP capabilities) with 1200-1400 births per year. We have a busy Emergency Department and an ICU that assists with management of some children. We have eight part time VMO paediatricians who rotate on-call responsibilities. We run four general paediatric outpatient clinics per week, as well as a paediatric diabetic clinic, a paediatric immigrant health clinic and outreach clinics to Stawell and Horsham. We have multiple visiting subspecialty clinics. We also maintain close links with the Royal Children’s Hospital and tertiary Melbourne NICU centres.

We have paediatric residents covering 24-hours per day. This registrar position comprises a team of 5 registrars and 1 fellow providing cover 24 hours per day. Responsibilities include daily ward rounds, outpatient clinics, emergency consultations, high-risk deliveries, student teaching, an ongoing education program and frequent departmental meetings. On-call requirements are 1 in 4 weekends and 1 night per week first on call, with consultant back up 24 hours per day. Remuneration is per Victorian Award with on call and call back payments.

Ballarat Health Services is a major training site for the University of Melbourne and Deakin Rural Clinical Schools. Senior staff are strongly committed to teaching and the professional development of Interns, HMOs and Registrars.

Ballarat offers a superb regional lifestyle with excellent public and private schools, recreational and sporting facilities, shopping, entertainment and cultural pursuits. Country or city living is available within minutes of the hospital and there is easy access to Melbourne (70 minutes).

To apply for these positions please submit your Curriculum Vitae and a cover letter. Please note, all attached documents must be either .doc or .pdf files.
Applications must be submitted on-line. Appointment is subject to a satisfactory police check and immunisation clearance.

  • Health, Wellness and Fitness
  • Hospital & Health Care

Tuning into Respectful Relationships Project Lead

Company Name Anglicare Victoria Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 2 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A flexible working arrangement that may include working from various Anglicare Victoria sites, as well as within prisons and from home. Flexible and negotiable work hours outside of agreed group times. Access to attractive salary packaging benefits.

About Us

At Anglicare Victoria our focus is on transforming the futures of children and young people, families and adults. Our work is based on three guiding pillars, Prevent, Protect, Empower. We offer a comprehensive network of services and seek to ensure the provision of high quality services that will bring about significant improvements in the life experience of the young people, children and families/caregivers with whom we work.

The Program

Tuning Into Respectful Relationships is a new psychoeducational group program for prisoners, residing in correctional facilities. The program's aims are to raise awareness of the elements of respectful relationships, impart practical knowledge and skills to help participants maintain, improve and develop relationships, and contribute to the participant's self-development.

The Role

This position provides the successful applicant with the opportunity to build, lead, and develop a new team. To work within the corrections system in order to build, establish and deliver the Tuning into Respectful Relationships program with the aim to assist participants to better understand the role of respect in their relationships and equip them with tools to make, maintain and improve their relationships. Please note that this leadership opportunity also comes group with facilitation responsibility.

To Be Successful In This Position You Will Need
  • A relevant tertiary qualification in Social Work, Psychology, Early Childhood Specialist and/or related behavioral sciences at degree level with substantial experience; or associate diploma level with substantial experience in the relevant service stream, or less formal qualifications with specialised skills sufficient to perform at this level.xx
  • Demonstrated ability and experience in program establishment including skills in staff recruitment, training, program development, and evaluation.
  • Ability to work autonomously as well as within a team environment
  • Experience and knowledge in group facilitation, including adult learning principles.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage targets and compile progress and data reports

Please Note: It is mandatory for the successful applicant to hold a current Working with Children Check and be prepared to undergo a National Criminal History Check prior to commencement.

For a detailed position description, PD_Project lead_East_June 2018.pdf

To apply for this position you will need to complete the online application. You will be requested to attach your resume and your responses to the Key Selection Criteria as separate documents.

For further enquiries contact Amy Youl on 0499 307 007

Applications close 13/7/2018

We encourage and welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People
